website_summaries.verdict: This workbench works like a dream for those who need to quickly set up and break down at job sites or around the house.
pros: Converts quickly between work table and sawhorse
Supports up to 300 pounds in work table mode and 1000 pounds in sawhorse mode, thanks to steel supports and fittings
Can be joined with other Worx products
Clamps hold up to 18 inch width materials
Folds to compact size and is fairly light (28 pounds)
cons: At 32 inches in height, it is a little too low to work on comfortably

customer_reviews.title: Nice work surface, made in China not the USA as listed.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy well made table. I needed two but for some unknown reason Amazon limited me to buying one, had to buy the second locally at a higher price. A word of clarification, the Amazon listing states country of origin USA, that is incorrect, it's made in China. I really wish Amazon would work on more accurate information in their listings.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Atwell

customer_reviews.title: Inept customer service and faulty quality
customer_reviews.text: Decent little work table for the money while it worked. I ran into a major problem though and it’s the reason why I will never buy another Worx product. The trigger on one of the clamps broke after only a few uses so I contacted customer service to see if they would replace it. They said no. I even said I would pay for it despite it being practically new. No deal. So now I basically just have a $100 plastic folding table.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome work table!! I was reluctant about the fact that it's molded plastic, but this table is nice and solid. Nothing to put together either; just pull out of the box and unfold it...it's ready. I was so happy with it, I bought a second one so I could connect them and use as a nice work area in my garage. I'm getting rid of my Black and Decker; this one's better.
customer_reviews.author: VA

customer_reviews.title: Good table, but clamps are weak and useless!
customer_reviews.text: Table is good, for what it is, but the clamps are totally useless. One already broke, it unclamps with very little pressure. I thought I was saving money, when I decided not to buy clamps from the hardware store and use the ones that came with the table, instead, but I was wrong! Not worth $100
customer_reviews.author: Jay Khoury

customer_reviews.title: Easily portable but not as functional as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Work table that is easily portable does come in handy when needing a workspace away from the garage area. However, I am very disappointed in the clamping system. I clamped down a piece of hard landscape timber and was using a sawzall to cut out a notch, and the clamps failed many times. I find it this table to be extremely over priced and do regret the purchase. It is not, however, a complete bust and will be used - but more for a place to set up and not really a work bench.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Underside does not support holding clamps as it's mostly hollow. Accompanying clamps are loose.
customer_reviews.text: While it's light, easy to fold and reasonable sturdy one BIG downside si that the undersides of the table are mostly hollow with some lines of plastic to make it rigid - this means that you can't reasonably hope to use a clamp on a workpiece for holding it stably. The accompanying clamps, while a nice touch do not really stay stable and they wiggle around to quite an extent. :(
customer_reviews.author: Maelstrom

customer_reviews.title: [very] light projects
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use it to cut plywood--shook too much. Good for small Jigsaw, drilling, wooden glue projects, but do not recommend for reciprocating saw cuts, saw anything more then 4 inches (or large cuts). It shook a lot; very disappointed, but considering it light weight my expectations were likely too high.
customer_reviews.author: parzival

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love this work table! It was a great help to my giant garden box project. The clamps were useful both attached to the table and separately, making this an even better value.
customer_reviews.author: J. McComb

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but could offer more flexibility in board placement
customer_reviews.text: Having a table of this type i super useful. I'm not sure if this particular one is better than the competition though. It comes with plastic "pins" that go into holes in the top of the table and can be used to brace wood against them. It would have been nice if the table had a the holes for these pins in more places, to give more control over where they are placed. In many ways this is an excellent tool. But there have been times that I wanted to cut a board in a certain direction and couldn't attach it to the table in a position that would let me make the cut I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Love

customer_reviews.title: Beware of contents inside the box
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Russian Christmas 2019. He didn't open the box for over a year due to heart issues, so it sat in the garage what we thought was a brand new table. With the ok from his Dr. to work on small projects he opened up the box only to find a 2 inch long gash hole on the table top. Talk about disappointing!!! Past the point of return, we are NOT happy. This was not.a shipping issue. This was purposely taped up to try to cover and sent to us at the cost of $100 from our wallet!
customer_reviews.author: tconnoll

customer_reviews.title: All sawhorses should have done what these will do!
customer_reviews.text: Don't ask why -- just buy two or more. (they link together!). They will change your life. Stable, flexible, strong and portable work surface of selectable size!! The clamps -- well they are OK -- not the very best quality but definitely able to hold things in place while glue sets, or you cut or rout or sand or whatever -- nice to have, and they ride in the slots on the table so they don't get in the way of the work. And bench dogs to hold things on the other end while clamping. All self stores and easily folds up into a nice easily moveable and stowable package.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer of All Things

customer_reviews.title: I’m a tiny 98lbs girl who is afraid of saw
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I was just looking for some clamps but decided to splurge and get this since I’m a first time homeowner with fixer upper house. I’m also very afraid of saws because I’m super light weight and the last time I tried a full sized circular saw, the thing recoiled and fling right up the table and almost cut my legs and hands...long story short—two years and many YouTube videos later., I realized I need a smaller saw and necessary clamps. Today I finally conquer my fear and made some shelves from old wood I have. I love diy and this table plus their small portable saw is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: TheCabinCoder

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy and feels very well engineered
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy and feels very well engineered...except for the bottom of the table. There are very few points to clamp down to since there is this weird lip around it. I've made it work, but it's a little awkward cutting plywood on this guy.
customer_reviews.author: Reid Mulkey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the build quality. Many nice features. Perfect if you need something to work in smaller area.
customer_reviews.author: bobcstl

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps this is a good as a portable workbench can be
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps this is a good as a portable workbench can be, but for hand sawing and many other tasks it is just not stable enough.
customer_reviews.author: J. Streit

customer_reviews.title: Best DIY product you’ll ever buy.
customer_reviews.text: There’s nothing to dislike about this workhorse. It’s built to last, everything has been thought through, the design spec is first class. I’ve had mine about a week now and used it extensively, it’s strong, sturdy and there’s a million different ways to combine the clamps, plugs or both to help keep pieces of wood/ metal whatever in place. All the movable parts have their own place on the table so there’s no loosing or forgetting anything whenever you transport the table anywhere. The whole thing folds and unfolds in seconds and can be carried around. This for me is one of the best DIY products I’ve ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Every DIY'er needs this
customer_reviews.text: I did research when looking for a portable work table including going to the several local hardware stores to check out what's in the market. This WORX work table seems to the most functional for my needs (I am a lite DIY'er). I received it and was able to quickly perform several tasks (sawing and fixing my vacuum) on it to my complete satisfaction; no more cramped back. Here's what I like about it: (1) table folds away very easily, (2) light and portable, (3) clamps that come with it work well, and (4) durable and light.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I purchased this a long time ago. Checked this against three other makes, and this is definitely the best. Easy to handle and set-up. Clamps work well, alone and with dogs. Have used it for ripping, cross cut, routing, gluing and other jobs. All worked well
customer_reviews.author: Just Sayin

customer_reviews.title: My One Regret is I Didn't Buy This Two Years Ago
customer_reviews.text: I am always inventing a workbench from sawhorses and 2x4s. Finally I decided that was getting old and about that time I saw this at Menards. During COVID I was staying home a bit more and when the weather got nice, I ordered this one from Amazon. It's great. Sturdy. I can use my rebar chop saw on it without concern. I may even get a second one for more table space. I haven't really put the clamps to hard use yet, but they seem reasonably sturdy. Easy to carry, store, and set up. I don't know how it would do on a full tilt construction site, but for my remodeling project inside and out, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ebooker

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent Bench!
customer_reviews.text: If I were to source, and I looked for a table with clamps, this was a steal and the quality is incredible! Two fast clamps that fit on the table when not in use and fold in, are amazing. A great design and fuction in one. You don't get this every day. I can see buying another to use in conjunction as they can join together. Love this! Could not have done my project and future projects without this.
customer_reviews.author: koogz

customer_reviews.title: An Oustanding Simple Work Table With Many Uses.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect, very solid, stable, great size and nicely constructed multi function work table. Have done many types of different projects easily and saves lots of time, nothing to just pull it out of the box and open when you need it and close it and put it back when not in use, for protection and keeping it like new and safe out of the way. Its just that simple. This is my third in several years and way better than the rest in many ways, besides its already put together, that can be a nightmare I like to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Ricanguy007.

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Best Work Bench any DIY could need
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I am amazed how many years how I have gotten by without this work bench. I am constantly building projects around the home, every week and have yet to discover any weakness for this bench. It is heavy and always stable; no matter if placed on concrete, rocks or dirt and does not move or wobble while using for any cutting or fabrication so far. Very easy to maneuver and store, folds easily and has locking to ensure staying open. The included clamps are super useful; both when attached to bench or used separately away from bench. WORX is my new tool line; bench, Weed Wacker and 4.5" saw so far. All High Quality, durable and affordable!
customer_reviews.author: T. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: It works great and is sturdy for typical diy usage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as a mobile workbench for projects around the house. It works great and is sturdy for typical diy usage. The clamps aren't the most robust clamps in the world, but they get the job done and are adequate for anyone wanting to diy projects in their home. Update: I’ve been using this for almost two years now, and it still works great with no issues. I use it out and indoors for all kinds of home projects. Very happy I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up. Easy to fold up to store.  My go to work table!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this folding work table. It is sturdy, easy to set up for working on small to medium projects and is easy to fold up for storing or transporting. It has four holding pegs that fit into surface mounted holes to help hold materials in place while you work with them. It also includes two quicks clamps for holding parts together while being worked on or glued. This is an affordable gift for a friend or anyone who likes to do projects but may not have a huge work area or doesn't want to use up a lot of space. I highly recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING quality! So simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - ZERO assembly required - Sets up in less than 10 seconds - Absolute ROCK solid construction - Clamps are excellent quality - Fold and ready to put away in about 10 seconds This is the finest little table I have ever owned. Every task that I threw at it (miter saw, clamping to name just a few) and performed like a champ! Could not be happier! Already recommending to others in my circle that can really use this awesome table... CONS: I didnt buy the WORX Clamping Sawhorse Pair with Bar Clamps, Built-in Shelf and Cord Hooks – WX065 But trust me...I'll remedy that.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos S.

customer_reviews.title: Best table yet
customer_reviews.text: I bought one a year ago and love it. I have not even used it to it's full potential yet. It is easy to set up and collapse and extreme sturdy. The clamps hold well and won't slip while holding a project because the clamps are locked into place flush with the table top. The table can attach to a second one if needed. So, I bought a second one just for that. Now the only con I can think of. While it is folded, there is no "handle" to grab. There is a place to hold, but moving the heavy table will take a toll on the hand.
customer_reviews.author: USMC

customer_reviews.title: Something for EVERY TOOLMAN
customer_reviews.text: How did I ever do with out this table?? So many options and adjustments. When I bought it, I thought I might have it out to use once a month or so. In the past two months I seem to have found something to use it for nearly EVERY DAY. Includes clamps and dogs, and has guides for saws, routers and other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Engineer

customer_reviews.title: So good i bought another one!
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice when something works exactly as it is supposed too. Makes for a very sturdy platform and is indeed multi functional. I had been using regular sawhorses for years and i wish i had made the jump sooner. Is very stable/flat and the additional clamps are great. Honestly I don't have a single bad thing to say about it. Bought one as a trial run and after the first time using it i bought another one. You can attach them to each other for a very big work space or use as traditional saw horses.
customer_reviews.author: JaredT

customer_reviews.title: Sturdier than expected - cool xtras
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this. It’s sturdy, much sturdier than we expected from the pictures. I’m not sure if this is a common feature or not (sorry, chick writing a review on behalf of her husband) but my husband loved that this comes with these handy spots to connect a second/third/etc table. This table had some features that set it apart from the others and the sturdiness and ease of setup/take down and storage makes it superior. He definitely would purchase this again and he’s actually asked for a second one. So we will be purchasing another one in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Mama of 6

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second one at this point. I was using table 1 as a work surface for a while, and it was great, that table then became the home of my miter saw. I got a 2nd table because I really liked the first one so much. Clamps are a nice touch, but I agree that they are not "high precision". Overall, it is a very good value for the money. Thick, heavy duty plastic, and it can be easily moved and folded out of the way. Great for mobile work or small work spaces. They have helped me immensely. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: M. Soltesz

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Great choice...little more but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st one. I think I picked a really good choice for my 1st one. It folds up nicely and conveniently. But it is so sturdy it is ridiculous! Light storage but when folded no storage. Unless you strap it to the unit. I wish the claps were a little sturdier without the orange "thingy mobobs"(see, my first one ever). Best purchase made to help me with my redecorating projects. It helps more than my man, ha. Nothing too bad to say about it, except when reading the instructions about putting on the claps. I was confused for a minute bc I couldn't read it. I figured it out in about two tries though.
customer_reviews.author: TheDisabledBeauty

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I have several portable saw horses, but this if by far the best -- and at a great price. I was shopping for benches like this which take "workbench dogs," and most were so expensive that I probably wouldn't have purchased them at this time. But this was at a very reasonable price and when I received it, I was not the least bit disappointed because it is so sturdy. It opens and stows easily. I also liked the fact that it came with clamps and holding pegs included which are easily stored on the unit itself.
customer_reviews.author: Joel A. Brondos

customer_reviews.title: Trigger clamps are wimpy
customer_reviews.text: I knew from the previous reviews that the trigger clamps were wimpy but the rest of this work table works nicely. And unfortunately the work table fittings for the trigger clamps is unique. You can't just replace them with a better unit. Otherwise everything thing seems solid and tight. The underside of the table is waffled, as you might expect, so clamping to the table is going to require some appropriate adjustment. Too bad that the manufacturer hasn't corrected the wimpy trigger clamp problem. For just a few bucks more this could be a truly great product.
customer_reviews.author: PatF

customer_reviews.title: Was excited until opening the box
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the box, noticed a 1.5 inch hole punched in the worktable top. Upon examining the box, there is a hole punched in it. I realize that shipping is not in the control of the manufacturer. Some padding may have helped. If I want a replacement through Amazon, I have to pay shipping, which will most likely cost at least a third, if not more, of what I paid for the worktable. Worktable looks like a good engineered design, except the table top material could use being a little thicker. Might not have busted is that was the case.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Adams

customer_reviews.title: Amazing versatile table.
customer_reviews.text: I love this table!. Its suprisingly sturdy for a composite table. I use it for cleaning guns, a parts table, cutting plywood, taking pictures of things to sell online. It's a great table. I got it on sale around the holidays and hope I can find it on sale again. I'll probably buy another one. You can link 2 together to have a larger surface area. The pockets are great for parts as well and the 1x1 grid is nice for taking pictures or quick size estimates.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Brillant Engineering on this multi-use tool!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this product. It is brilliant engineering. WORX should give the people who developed this a big bonus! It is solidly built. It does everything it say it will do and with a little ingenuity, much more. I have built a table, topped with slippery melamine that simply clamps ontop and acts as a out-feed table for my table saw. I can pair this with a simple saw horse and support a large 4x8 sheet of plywood by using the 2x4 holders when it is partially closed! True ingenuity!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Amazing portable work bench
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I have 2 of them now. It is amazing how well thought out this work bench is. It is light and compact. You can use as a saw horse or prop up just one side for a smaller space. When open, there is a nice shelf underneath. Lots of little spaces to put lose screws or tools. It comes with 2 clamps that slide into the built in tracks. And it is strong. I am a heavy guy and can stand on it, no problem. so you can definitely put heavy stuff on it. Just a great compact work surface to whip out and use to assemble or fix stuff.
customer_reviews.author: A. Whitman

customer_reviews.title: Works  well
customer_reviews.text: I like how sturdy it is, it is easily expanded and locked in, also breaks down easily. I was not impressed with the small clamps, they are ok, but because it is plastic for the grip and locking mechanism, it is not strong. Material will move when enough pressure is applied. I did not buy it for the ability to self clamp, so that is why I still like the portable table. ease of use is great and it is small in size when folded in. if that is what you need, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fold, portable, and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this. I didn't feel comfortable sawing on my garage floor so I got this table to finish our porch deck flooring, and it was great. This was my first project that involved sawing anything and now with my table, I'm excited for some new projects. I realized it's the same brand as the saw I ordered from Amazon too, so I think I may have a brand preference now. Will update if it doesn't work out after more use.
customer_reviews.author: ValO

customer_reviews.title: It can't fly, but that's its only flaw
customer_reviews.text: If you need a quality sawhorse that is multifaceted, this is it! It's clamp system is pretty baller, it comes in really handy if you're a soloartist DIYer, allowing you to hold stuff down while you waterboar, er, make your shelf. I've used it for a number of projects, including cutting wood, staining stuff, and general storage of tools. A lot of thought was put into the creation of this sawhorse, and it shows. It seems really sturdy, so it might be able to hold your gf as well as the wood you can throw at it! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Bret VA

customer_reviews.title: great for small duty jobs
customer_reviews.text: no way is this a strong duty work horse but it's a quick easy go to for small jobs. The clamps, as many bad reviews said, broke within just a few days but I bought other third party clamps at the same time because I expected it. as a versatile small work table it's excellent and totally easy to open up and snap together. The table itself is pretty lightweight, so though the clamps are a complete and total FAIL, the stability of the table is great.
customer_reviews.author: JAG

customer_reviews.title: Used it to create a 2x4 based workbench and it was the MVP.
customer_reviews.text: For the price and maybe even at twice the price it is amazing. The included clamps are key. I did not want to purchase a miter saw and was able to use a circular saw to make all of the cuts and even simulate a table saw to make reasonably straight cuts on an 8ft piece of plywood. I would have done a much worse job without it and it just folds up and could also be part of a saw horse setup is a huge bonus. Pretty brilliant and the 5 stars are very justified.
customer_reviews.author: Toby J. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Good work bench with one issue
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well made work bench. It is pretty strong for being made of plastic, although I wouldn’t want to put too much stress on it. The included clamps are a nice touch and work pretty well. Only thing is that they slide into the work bench with a fair amount of slop. Not enough to worry about them coming out of the work bench but enough so that even though the piece is held tightly in the clamp, the clamp and piece can wobble on the bench. It is not a problem if your piece is large enough to be held by both clamps, only an issue if it is being held by only one clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W. Hinch

customer_reviews.title: Needed two
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition for a location where a permanent work bench would not be possible. I needed two to make a sufficient work space, but connecting them is an advantage and gives me plenty of space for my needs. The clamps and moveable project stops give me many options for my small woodworking projects. They fold easily and are very sturdy. Make great sawhorses as well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: steveh

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected, vices are small too. Not worth $100.
customer_reviews.text: The vices do not span the entire width of the table, which I thought would have been common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Perry M. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: A great useful well built portable workbench
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the WORX portable workbench, it is solid versatile and useful for many different type projects, I do a lot of woodworking and found this portable workbench to be a very useful necessity, I wish I hadn’t waited so long to get one, Easy to use very solid versatile workbench that folds and stores easily in small spaces. I am very pleased with this workbench only wished I had bought it sooner. If you’re looking for well-built versatile workbench don’t hesitate to buy this, you Will be happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Muetzel

customer_reviews.title: Strong, compact and perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this table! It has been a life saver for my projects and when I’m using my miter saw. Very sturdy and I love that it folds up and doesn’t take up much space at all which is why I chose it. I don’t have a garage or shed so needed something that I could put out if the way when not in use. The clamps that it comes with are also super handy and I love that the store on the side when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: The only work bench you will ever need, if not connect another one !
customer_reviews.text: Love this work bench so many applications to use it for. Built one of those homemade foldable ones you see on Pintrest. Not hard for the average do it you self type person. The time it takes to build it is not worth it in my opinion. Just buy one of these and be done with it ! Perfect for the homeowner and professionals as well, wish it was a bit cheaper though... Seems like it will last a lifetime though. And you can attach more tables if your needs grow, easy to store and fold.
customer_reviews.author: Don Ing

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy table
customer_reviews.text: This table is a great work bench for those DIYers. First, it is quite sturdy despite being made of plastic. I have put some weight on it and it doesn't budge. The clamps hold well also. The rulers etched on the surface are practical, as well as the trays, which you can use for screws or small parts. Easy to fold and store without taking much space. You can't go wrong with table. I would gladly pay a bit more (when comparing to others such as the B&D.) I also bought one as a present and the person loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Cortes Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Surface not level!
customer_reviews.text: The only real complaint I have is the surface is not level. If you do work on it that doesn’t require it to be leveled then no issue here. I need it to be level for the type of work I do so this work table limits me with the type of projects I can use it for. A shame because it’s a sturdy table.
customer_reviews.author: Titus Tiplea

customer_reviews.title: Very nice work table
customer_reviews.text: It's a great work table for occasional work around the home. Professionals will find it useful too around a worksite since is easy to transport and can be attached to a second work table to make it longer if needed. It's great that it comes with two quick clamps and 4 holding pegs so secure the piece you are working on. I am happy with this purchase and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hecco

customer_reviews.title: Genius!
customer_reviews.text: If over 1400 - 5 Star reviews wasn’t enough already... I’ll add mine in there too. This Table is awesome, genius, sturdy, heavy but not to heavy and I’m ordering a second one to connect them together!!! - for those people wanting a miter saw table I would recommend a miter saw stand with a quick release rail system. You can get a WEN brand miter saw stand for about $115 that is a way better option than a table.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC  WORX Pegasus table
customer_reviews.text: The WORX Pegasus table is brilliant, I live in Australia and the delivery cost me as much as the work table but it really is worth it. This table out performs it competitors in so many ways. Very happy with my purchase and highly recommend it. AMAZON had it delivered to my door in very quick time. I live in a unit so it replaces my work bench and folds well for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's sturdy, holds up well
customer_reviews.text: Use it for DIY projects around the house, it's sturdy, holds up well, and is light weight. I got a couple of coast of saw dust and paint all over it and it still holding up well, folding up. I stray it down with the hose and stray some WD40 on the moving parts to keep it clean and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sweet bench
customer_reviews.text: this is a nice work bench for light duty diy people. easy to use and well packaged. not even U.P.S. could damage them. ive received items from U.P.S. that looked like they fell from a high altitude aircraft. thats no joke. i have had this bench now since april and have used it almost daily. i should have bought this long before and am considering buying a second one. this is a well made work table and the clamps work great with it. i highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: william c freeh

customer_reviews.title: Everything the advertising promised
customer_reviews.text: The work table saw horse arrived on time, was well packaged, and came out ready for use. The unit folds open easily (watch you hand to not get pinched) and snaps into position for use. The table is well thought out and has lots of extras, including four clamps. I liked this unit so much I bought 2 so I can have a nice table in my shop to work on and then fold up and put away.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bush

customer_reviews.title: Versatile sturdy work bench, which has many uses
customer_reviews.text: The table is pretty easy to set up. I wish the table didn't have so much packaging. I look forward to using it in the future on various wood working, art and home improvement projects. I do wish the table had more table dogs (like 6 instead of 4). I paid $92 for it in 2019 and notice it costs over $200 in July 2020. Wait for the holidays to purchase this table. I also own the Worx Sidekick table too.
customer_reviews.author: happykat

customer_reviews.title: Solid, easy to setup table
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of foldable sawhorses that were tedious to setup and hard to clamp to. What an upgrade this is. It's super easy to setup and take down and it has a nice integrated clamp system. I bought a 2nd one for when I have something really long, or when I want to link them together to make one big work table. I like that they can operate as simple saw horses too without even unfolding the top.
customer_reviews.author: ah

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Lateral Sway
customer_reviews.text: It may be rated to hold 900 lbs, but if you try hand sawing a board it’s like sawing on a rocking chair. Too much lateral movement.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapiron

customer_reviews.title: No Need For Anything Else.
customer_reviews.text: This sawhorse is all you need for any project. I purchased 2 and I love the feature where you can combine them. I also like the feature they can be folded up and down as needed. I would highly recommend this product to anyone based on numerous features including weight and durability. The added clamps are a huge bonus as you don't have to purchase them separately.
customer_reviews.author: Chad R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice work surface
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself for Christmas and was pleasantly surprised how sturdy it is. I seem to always be doing work around the house myself and this will provide me the work surface and second pair of hands I need sometimes to get the job done. Large enough to place a small portable table or miter saw on and high enough that I don't have to bend uncomfortably over to do my work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought it a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: I have a small shop, I needed something easy to open, close, and store, this is perfect. The clamps are great, it actually gives me another set of hands for assembling the small projects I create. I also use it as an outfeed table, for my table saw, I also use it as a saw horse, I have put my portable table saw on it, my miter saw, my planer, and my jointer on it and I have permanently attached power strip on it,..it is a workshop must, I should have bought it a long time ago
customer_reviews.author: TeeCrawler

customer_reviews.title: excellent sturdy sawhorse worktable combo
customer_reviews.text: This item actually arrived two days earlier than anticipated. Removed it from the box and it was ready for business with no assembly required at all. I have owned a Black and Decker Workmate for years and this has many more features than that. All in all, it seems like all of the features will make it worthy of the money paid.
customer_reviews.author: dannyboyinaz

customer_reviews.title: Buy quality once.
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews about people buying cheap tables and having to spend a lot time assembling them, and even having to buy better hardware (nuts, bolts, washers) I decided to "step-up" and buy this already assembled item. Boy am I happy. Once out of the box it's ready to use. It has positive lock in clicks to the various positions (reminds me of a "Little Giant" ladder). Use is very intuitive and directions not needed (unlike something you'd have to assemble). This was just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to fold, big work space, I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy and I am able to do my small projects on it with no problem! I do have to figure out how to keep the clamps in the table on the side with the clamps handles. The table is also easy to fold and move. Sort of related: Be careful walking around it when it's dark. Stubbed 3 toes and thought I broke them. It's funny now but sheesh this thing is solid and hurt a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, waterproof, well done!  Only deficit (not adjustable height
customer_reviews.text: I like the sturdy frame, waterproof construction materials, and foldability.vJusr wish the height was adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Clawdan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and perfect for the DIY'er
customer_reviews.text: I have needed this table for the last 20 years and am so glad I finally got one. I used it to hold a tile saw for a recent project and it worked great. It is nice that it is plastic rather than wood because it makes cleanup easy. It is very sturdy and has some great bells and whistles. I was debating between this an a similarly-priced Black & Decker table and I am very glad I chose this one. The quality for the price can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Boy Mom

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Price increased 40% in a year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these WORX Pegasus Multi-Function Work Table and Sawhorse with Quick Clamps and Holding Pegs – WX051 because they are versatile and stable. I was thinking of getting two more but I noticed the price went up by 40%. I paid $99.00/table about a year ago. Why the 40% increase in price? I'll find an alternative instead.
customer_reviews.author: trashworthy

customer_reviews.title: 9/10s of the way there.
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for something like this for years. Blows my Black & Decker Work Mate away. One small complaint: I wish it locked closed as well as open. If you don't hold it just so, it tends to want to open up on you when transporting it around the site.
customer_reviews.author: The River Hermit

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to set-up and break-down, metal in spots where fatigue or stress would commonly occur (hinges, slide rails, stand levers and catches), and (most important) well engineered to provide a bunch of useful bracket and work holder clamping options. I can't begin to tell you how much more useful this portable work bench has proved to be. A huge improvement over my B&D Workmate.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is my go-to work bench when I have to go somewhere other than my workshop.
customer_reviews.text: I love the portability of the bench. It's a little heavy, but very sturdy and easy to set up and take down. It has good clamps attached so there is no run to the garage if I need to clamp something down. This is a great work bench, you can't go wrong. One caution is for a pinch of your hand on the table top when setting up, it can deliver quite a blood blister. You'll only do it once. LOL
customer_reviews.author: mikemcclellan

customer_reviews.title: Rare moment when you pay too little!
customer_reviews.text: You know those rare times when you buy a product and you think it is so great, you would pay for more for it than you did? That's what this is. At around $100 to your door, this is an absolute steal. Easy to fold, surprisingly sturdy, accurate built in rulers, and easy to use. And the clamps work great and are also easy to configure. I suppose if you are a professional carpenter working on it all day it would not hold up, but for the average homeowner just buy it now!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: I've use one for over a year; then I bought two more for an extended workbench. Very heavy materials. Quite functional. Zero manufacturing defects; properly packaged with corners protected. One can swing up one side or both sides. They snap in place level. All three of mine mate perfectly. These work tables are heavy duty. They work for all applications. Top surface has pockets for screws, etc. that one can use or not.
customer_reviews.author: Wishful Dreams - Tim Townsend

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed all portable work tables that were in this competitive line. After reviewing all that I could I ordered this unit. It did not disappoint. It sets up easy. It is sturdy w/o wobbles. The clamps are easy to operate, and yes they are not the most robust units but they do hold well but if you need to hold large heavy objects I suggest using other suitable clamps. After trying this for a couple of days I purchased a 2nd unit.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good little table - sturdy and saves space when not in use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this table because I am renting a house, and did not want to spend a bunch of money on workbenches and such that I would have to try and move eventually. Was not quite sure about this one, but I read a bunch of reviews and gave it a shot. I was pleasantly surprised with the construction. The table seems very solid, and once you hold everything up, it locks into place and has absolutely no give. Have not had an opportunity to really put it through its paces yet, but just using it as a table, it seems just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great, stable work table
customer_reviews.text: I use this work table all the time. The built in clamps are quite useful. The table is sturdy and I've never had any issues with wobble or feeling like my project isn't supported well. The underside of the tabletop is not flat so it's difficult to clamp anything down (vertical as opposed to horizonal), but that's my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have been watching it since Christmas and really wanted to pull the trigger and buy it and then it went on sale so why not. Well, I am really impressed. Easy to open and set up, heaver then I thought it would be, sturdier then I thought it would be. I am really glad I bought it and even at regular price, it would be worth it so I am double impressed now that I got it on sale. It's really a great little work table.
customer_reviews.author: J. GaglianoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for smaller shops
customer_reviews.text: My house is small.. my garage is even smaller. I can store this thing against the wall until I need it. I can open it up outside and have ample space to complete most projects. I wouldn't consider the clamps it comes with to be super sturdy, but they've held up to all the light duty projects I've used them for. Setting it up/breaking it down takes only seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for clamping.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine table with zero edge clamping ability. The rails and dogs are fine enough for the price, but the edge of the table is absolutely awful. The plastic is soft and bendy and the edge isn't solid on the underside. There is not a single proper spot where the clamps have a flush mounting spot on the underside of the table.
customer_reviews.author: Blackbird

customer_reviews.title: Love it... already helped with three project
customer_reviews.text: Great item, already completed three projects, one of which was holding galvanized pipe while cutting with a hacksaw! The clamps worked great and using the channels as a guide to prevent rolling was perfect. Got several big projects coming up. Love how it folds up nice and tidy, great for our small apt.
customer_reviews.author: Triskelion55

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift for my husband Christmas 2019.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had his eye on this for sometime now and I purchased it for a Christmas gift, 2019. He is a housing contractor and he is absolutely obsessed with it! Very worth the price and shipping was lightning fast! I am very happy that my husband is very happy! Sorry my review took so long. 😊 Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa Webber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent work table
customer_reviews.text: I bought this several months ago and it's an easy five star rating. Sturdy, compact, and light weight. I've used it for myriad projects and have only found one little thing to complain about. The rubber pads on the clips wear out rather quickly and I've been unable to find replacements. Aside from that, this is perfect for the DIYer. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Poor guy meets his favorite purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED this product! If you have a welding or wood working job this table will totally blow you away. I’ve had saw horses and portable tables like this before and they would SHRED MY Fingernails or smash my finger tips when I used them. Not this one they thought of everything and it’s really easy to throw in my car and bring to a job. It really helps to look like a bad ass with these very cool portable tables. Wow I cannot wait to buy another and make a work bench out of these! I could go on and on
customer_reviews.author: Nice poor guy

customer_reviews.title: Just buy one.
customer_reviews.text: Love this table. Will i use it to its fullest capability? Not sure. But love the pop up work surface anytime i need it. Easy fold away make it a breeze to store until needed. Thinking about a second one and using in place of saw horses. You will definitely find this handy!
customer_reviews.author: Rylsngrd

customer_reviews.title: Great portable work table
customer_reviews.text: These tables are a godsend. We have a small garage, it’s full of stuff. These are so portable and easy to assemble and fold down to store and take up little space. We have two that quickly can be connected to make a larger workspace, and the clamps work really well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: N. Abdallah

customer_reviews.title: This is great
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a few months now, both with building some rooms downstairs and for a cedar strip canoe project. Nice sturdy stand/table. I love the clamps and am thinking of purchasing another one.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Good work table
customer_reviews.text: I keep this table folded and flat against my garage wall where it takes up little space. When I have a project and use it for a tool table or a sanding or wood cutting project or anything where a sturdy table comes in handy it performs very well. I am happy with this table and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff2468

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I LOVE this work bench big time! Of course I'm not using it for woodworking I'm using it for repairing Bird Scooters and it's perfect for my needs. I like how I can fold one side down and clamp the scooter to the bench. It's high enough that it doesn't make my back side either. I have places to stash my tools and nice little built in dished out area's to hold my screws and such so the don't get lost. I'm a happy camper for sure. Best money I've spent to help me wrench on my stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry K

customer_reviews.title: The portable workbench I should have had all along
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It's the portable workbench I should had years ago. Its sturdy, and has all the little add-ons that just make working on a project go smoothly, like clamps and hooks for your tools. It doesnt wiggle or sway when you're using it. And the material wont rot with age.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ritchey

customer_reviews.title: Good portable worktable
customer_reviews.text: Table works well for me to work on tools and small projects. Clamps seem fragile but I have better ones I use anyway. The small trays help keep nuts and bolts organized. Big enough surface to hold drill and other tools while working on chainsaw. Easy enough to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Kenmbz

customer_reviews.title: Great portable work table.
customer_reviews.text: I love this work table! Very sturdy and includes several adjustable clamps. Very convenient to use, although I have pinched my fingers a few times folding it up.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with this work bench
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1) Great clamping system, works well 2) Lightweight for the strength 3) Folds easily 4) Won't rust or rot Cons: 1) Wish it was about 3-5" taller (I'm over 6 foot and it seems a little low for me. Other than that, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: JayBee

customer_reviews.title: SO HAPPY I PURCHASED THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this table! I'm very crafty and my husband always rolls his eyes at the toys that I get for my hobby's. He said that I didn't need it because we have a work bench, but guess what??? He has used it and of course I rub his face in it. I love how easy it is to collapse and the grooves in it allows me to hold my bits without them rolling off or getting lost. I'm going to purchase an attachment for it so it can be bigger.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleMac

customer_reviews.title: Best table I have so far
customer_reviews.text: Love this table so far. I bought a couple different ones at the same time and this one is my favorite so far. Very easy to open and close, sturdy, clamp storage is just ok. getting clamps out of the table slots took some figuring out for me but know i know and it does not bother me at all. There is a learning curve to just about everything so no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P Overholt

customer_reviews.title: I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: Getting to old to work on my knees anymore. These are excellent work benches for Joe above average Carpenter. I took one to a job with a professional carpenter. Before the end of the job he bought his own. And I bought a second one. The little tabs that hold the two together don’t work very well. But you can clamp them if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Meyerhoff

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. Very durable and with 2 clamps this was the bang for the buck compare to any other ones I've seen at Home Depot or Lowe's.
customer_reviews.author: Karyl

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best workbench out of the four I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: I researched for lightweight, collapsible, and features once assembled,easy to store, and not flimsy. Could not be more satisfied. I use it with saws, router, & a grinder. It goes outside sets up and up easily. This is the real deal. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B. Lautner

customer_reviews.title: Useful for many shop tasks and others
customer_reviews.text: Quick setup and breakdown. Good clamping arrangements. Solid work surface. Have used for several wood shop tasks and as a portable work table for some tasks away from home. Not hard to handle and load, but glad it's not any heavier. To use as just a portable table, clamps can be removed to reduce carrying weight a little. Overall, it's a winner.
customer_reviews.author: G. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great portable workbench
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a workshop and have been using a pair of saw horses and a old Black & Deck wood and metal portable workbench to do projects in my house. This workbench has become my go to portable workbench for my miter saw and table saw not to mention for anything else i need. Its easy to use, strong enough to support my power tools and light enough to easily carry or move around and store away. I like the built in clamps that help out on woodworking projects and i like the ability to link additional one's together to make a bigger work space. I'm looking to purchase another one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Matt D

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I usually cut my wood straddled over pieces of wood. Didn't think I needed something like this. However, bit the bullet so to speak and spent the money - Expensive for me. Glad I did. Works great when you are working alone, and need wood to stay in place (clamp) while cutting. Now I just need to find space in my garage to store it.
customer_reviews.author: Chrystel

product_meta.title: WORX Pegasus Multi-Function Work Table and Sawhorse with Quick Clamps and Holding Pegs – WX051
product_meta.description: Style:Table&Sawhorse w/Clamps&Holding PegsTake on your favorite projects in whole new way with the innovative WORX Pegasus. The Pegasus is a versatile work station that converts from a table to a sawhorse in seconds. It can be joined with other Pegasus tables to create a larger work surface and includes a dual clamping system to hold any object securely in place. As a worktable, the Pegasus offers a 31” x 25” surface capable of supporting up to 300 lbs.; the unique link-lock system ensures your Pegasus table will hold heavier materials without buckling or folding. Two quick-adjusting bar clamps slide along the built-in tabletop channels and act like a second set of hands to hold straight-edged materials in place for cutting, gluing, painting, varnishing and any other DIY tasks. Four holding pegs (we call ‘em clamp dogs) can be rearranged across the tabletop to secure rounded or irregularly shaped objects. You can also remove the clamps and simply fold down the sides of the Pegasus for a sturdy sawhorse that can support up to 1,000 lbs. In sawhorse mode, the Pegasus has indentation wells designed to help hold a standard 2x4 steady so you can work more safely and easily. The Pegasus compact and lightweight design means you can take it anywhere. A built-in lower shelf holds tools and a power strip to keep everything easily accessible, organized and out of the way. When you’re done for the day, the Pegasus folds flat for easy storage—perfect for those with a smaller workspace or garage. Whether you’re a DIY lover, a crafter, or a woodworker, the WORX Pegasus is the perfect companion for every project on your list. Collapsible workbench design
feature_bullets: Versatile worktable converts to a sawhorse or work bench in seconds – no assembly required
Compact, foldable and lightweight for go-anywhere usage and storage – only 5” depth when folded
Worktable supports up to 300 lbs., sawhorse supports up to 1,000 lbs. – legs lock for added security
Includes two (2) Quick Clamps and four (4) clamp dogs to secure a variety of materials and shapes
Tabletop measures 31”x 25” or 725 sq. in., 32” height, 30 lbs. weight

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,974 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
